intro: Hesperantha flava, commonly known as the yellow marsh orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is adapted to moist, sandy soils. Its roots are fibrous, and it produces small, greenish leaves that help in photosynthesis. Hesperantha flava is often found in swampy or marshy environments, where it thrives in the humid and nutrient-rich conditions.
